item.title: “I Just Can’t Wait to be King”

item.title: Cross-Pollination
item.dc:creator: Joy Garnett
item.description: I’ve spent the past few years organizing materials that were left behind by my late grandfather, Ahmed Zaky Abushâdy (1892-1955), the well-known Egyptian Romantic poet—and physician, inventor, and bee scientist. Early on in my research, I became aware of two distinct narratives in the biographical literature: Abushâdy the Romantic Poet and Abushâdy the Bee Scientist. … Continue reading Cross-Pollination →

item.title: Archives and Canons
